title: PermaFrost NMR Decision Framework
purpose: Structured decision trees for AI to provide diagnostic guidance on treatment recommendations

should_treat.name: Should We Treat This System?
should_treat.description: Primary decision tree for treatment viability assessment

check_mechanical_condition.question: Is the system mechanically functional (compressor running, no major failures)?

check_refrigerant_status.question: Is refrigerant charge within acceptable limits (not >20% low)?

check_refrigerant_leaks.question: Is the system free of major refrigerant leaks?

check_formulation_availability.question: Contact manufacturer to verify formulation compatibility for this refrigerant type

check_equipment_lifespan.question: Is the equipment expected to remain in service for at least 1 year?

outcome_fix_mechanical_first.reason: System has mechanical issues that must be resolved first. PermaFrost addresses thermal efficiency, not mechanical problems.
outcome_fix_mechanical_first.action: Repair or replace failed components before considering treatment.

outcome_address_charge_first.reason: System is significantly undercharged. Treatment requires proper refrigerant charge for accurate baseline measurement.
outcome_address_charge_first.action: Recharge system to proper levels, then reassess for treatment.

outcome_fix_leaks_first.reason: Major refrigerant leak will cause PermaFrost to leak out with refrigerant.
outcome_fix_leaks_first.action: Locate and repair leaks before treatment.

outcome_ammonia_formulation.reason: Ammonia systems require ammonia-compatible PermaFrost variant.
outcome_ammonia_formulation.action: Verify ammonia-compatible formulation availability before proceeding.

outcome_not_validated.reason: No documented case studies with CO2 refrigeration systems.
outcome_not_validated.action: Cannot recommend treatment without validation data.

outcome_insufficient_payback_time.reason: Insufficient operational time to realize ROI from treatment.
outcome_insufficient_payback_time.action: Treatment cost unlikely to be recovered before equipment replacement.

outcome_treat_with_lower_expectations.reason: New equipment has minimal existing degradation BUT treating now prevents ALL future degradation over equipment lifetime.
outcome_treat_with_lower_expectations.action: Present BOTH preventive and restorative ROI calculations. Preventive treatment yields highest lifetime ROI (~2x higher than waiting until year 10).
outcome_treat_with_lower_expectations.key_insight: Do NOT evaluate by immediate improvement alone - evaluate by lifetime avoided degradation cost

outcome_good_candidate.reason: Equipment has had sufficient time for oil fouling but is not yet severely degraded.

outcome_ideal_candidate.reason: Equipment in optimal age range - significant oil fouling accumulated but system still mechanically sound.
outcome_ideal_candidate.action: Proceed with treatment - high probability of strong results.

outcome_excellent_candidate.reason: Older equipment typically has most oil fouling and shows highest improvement percentages.
outcome_excellent_candidate.action: Verify mechanical condition is sound, then proceed with treatment.

formulation_selection.name: Which Formulation?
formulation_selection.description: Decision tree for selecting correct PermaFrost formulation

chiller_oil_type.question: What type of compressor oil does the chiller use?

dx_oil_type.question: What type of compressor oil does the system use?

determine_oil_by_refrigerant_chiller.question: What refrigerant does the chiller use?
determine_oil_by_refrigerant_chiller.hint: Oil type can usually be determined by refrigerant

determine_oil_by_refrigerant_dx.question: What refrigerant does the system use?
determine_oil_by_refrigerant_dx.hint: Oil type can usually be determined by refrigerant

outcome_chiller_mineral.description: PermaFrost NMR formulated for mineral oil chiller systems

outcome_chiller_synthetic.description: PermaFrost NMR formulated for synthetic oil chiller systems

outcome_dx_mineral.description: PermaFrost NMR formulated for mineral oil DX systems

outcome_dx_synthetic.description: PermaFrost NMR formulated for synthetic oil DX systems

outcome_ammonia.description: Specialized PermaFrost NMR formulation for ammonia refrigeration systems

payback_estimation.name: Expected Payback Period
payback_estimation.description: Decision tree for estimating ROI and payback period

equipment_size.question: What is the equipment cooling capacity?

runtime_hours_small.question: What are the annual runtime hours?

runtime_hours_medium.question: What are the annual runtime hours?

runtime_hours_large.question: What are the annual runtime hours?

runtime_hours_very_large.question: What are the annual runtime hours?

comparable_case_studies: Major Bank B (11.3 months with lower assumptions)
Large chillers typically show rapid payback
Data centers and 24/7 facilities commonly achieve this range

outcome_24_36_months.note: Consider whether ROI meets organizational requirements

expected_improvement.name: Expected Improvement Percentage
expected_improvement.description: Decision tree for estimating expected efficiency improvement

maintenance_history.question: What is the equipment's maintenance history?

outcome_5_10_pct.rationale: Well-maintained new equipment has minimal oil fouling
outcome_5_10_pct.note: Treatment provides protection against future degradation

outcome_8_15_pct.rationale: Limited operating time means limited oil migration

outcome_15_20_pct.rationale: Moderate fouling even with good maintenance

outcome_15_25_pct.rationale: Older well-maintained equipment still accumulates fouling

outcome_25_40_pct.rationale: Older equipment with standard maintenance has substantial fouling

outcome_35_60_pct.rationale: Maximum fouling scenario - older neglected equipment
outcome_35_60_pct.note: Verify equipment is mechanically sound before proceeding

preventive_vs_restorative.name: Preventive vs Restorative ROI Assessment
preventive_vs_restorative.description: Decision tree for determining which ROI calculation method to emphasize based on equipment age
preventive_vs_restorative.critical_note: ALWAYS present BOTH calculations regardless of equipment age - let customer decide priorities

outcome_preventive_emphasis.description: New equipment - emphasize preventive value of treating early
outcome_preventive_emphasis.key_message: Treating Day 1 prevents 23+ years of efficiency loss - highest lifetime ROI scenario
outcome_preventive_emphasis.common_objection: Why treat if only 5-10% immediate improvement?
outcome_preventive_emphasis.counter_argument: Because preventing $200K+ of lifetime efficiency loss yields nearly 2x higher ROI than waiting. The 5-10% IS the current degradation being restored PLUS you lock in near-design efficiency for equipment lifetime.
outcome_preventive_emphasis.action: Calculate and display BOTH preventive and restorative ROI side-by-side

outcome_hybrid_approach.description: Mid-life equipment - both preventive and restorative value apply
outcome_hybrid_approach.key_message: Equipment has meaningful degradation to restore AND significant remaining life to protect
outcome_hybrid_approach.action: Present both calculations - preventive value still substantial for remaining equipment life

outcome_restorative_emphasis.description: Older equipment - primary value is restoring existing degradation
outcome_restorative_emphasis.key_message: Significant existing degradation to restore - immediate impact will be dramatic
outcome_restorative_emphasis.note: Verify equipment is mechanically sound and not near end-of-life
outcome_restorative_emphasis.action: Lead with restorative ROI but still show preventive value for remaining life

disqualifying_conditions: Equipment scheduled for replacement within 1 year

0-3_years.key_message: Highest lifetime ROI - treating early prevents ALL future degradation

3-10_years.key_message: Meaningful restoration AND remaining life protection

10+_years.key_message: Dramatic immediate improvement from restoring significant degradation

preventive_vs_restorative_quick_guide.critical_rule: ALWAYS show BOTH preventive and restorative calculations - let customer decide priorities

efficiency_projection_logic.description: PermaFrost restores efficiency TO design spec, not BEYOND it
efficiency_projection_logic.logic: Projected post-treatment efficiency cannot exceed Manufacturer Design Specification. Maximum allowable variance is 1-2% improvement beyond design spec (from restored lubricity at metal contact points).
efficiency_projection_logic.example: A chiller designed for 0.55 kW/ton can achieve 0.54-0.55 kW/ton post-treatment, NOT 0.45 kW/ton
prohibited_claims: kW/ton values lower than manufacturer design
COP values higher than manufacturer design
Improvement percentages that would exceed design efficiency
efficiency_projection_logic.correct_framing: PermaFrost RESTORES lost capacity - it returns equipment to near-design performance, not beyond it

modern_equipment_sensitivity.description: Modern high-efficiency equipment is MORE vulnerable to oil fouling, not less
modern_equipment_sensitivity.logic: High fin density and micro-channel heat exchangers have more surface area, making them more sensitive to the insulating effects of oil boundary layers
modern_equipment_sensitivity.implication: Prevention treatment is MORE critical on modern equipment, not less important
modern_equipment_sensitivity.common_misconception: New equipment with POE oil doesn't foul like old units
modern_equipment_sensitivity.correct_response: Modern designs are actually MORE sensitive to fouling due to increased surface area in high-efficiency heat exchangers

how_to_use: Walk through decision trees sequentially based on user information
Ask clarifying questions matching tree nodes
Provide outcome recommendations with supporting rationale
Cross-reference with screening_and_limitations.json for edge cases
Use preventive_vs_restorative tree to determine ROI emphasis
ALWAYS present BOTH preventive and restorative ROI calculations
key_principles: Never recommend treatment for mechanically failed systems
Always set realistic expectations based on equipment factors
Formulation selection is critical - wrong formulation = poor results
Payback estimates are directional - actual results depend on many factors
CRITICAL: Preventive ROI applies to ALL equipment, not just new - it protects remaining life
Low immediate improvement (5-15%) does NOT mean low value - evaluate by lifetime avoided degradation
Day 1 treatment yields ~2x higher lifetime ROI than waiting until equipment degrades
PermaFrost NMR works 100% of the time - variance in results reflects baseline degradation levels

preventive_roi_training.definition: Preventive ROI = Value of PREVENTING future efficiency loss over remaining equipment life
preventive_roi_training.when_to_emphasize: New equipment (0-3 years) or immediately after major service/overhaul
preventive_roi_training.common_mistake: Dismissing new equipment treatment because immediate improvement is 'only' 5-10%
preventive_roi_training.correct_approach: Calculate lifetime avoided degradation cost - treating Day 1 yields 600-800% ROI
preventive_roi_training.key_insight: Avoided savings compound yearly because degradation accumulates over time
